qas.question: How many buildings are on BYU's main campus?
How many acres are included in BYU's main campus?
Where is BYU's main campus located?
How many miles of shelving are in BYU's Harold B. Lee Library?
Which BYU building is the tallest in Provost, Utah?
What sits on 295 acres in Provo, Utah?

plausible_answers.text: The main campus in Provo, Utah

qas.question: What is nestled at the base of the Timpanogos Mountains?
What is known as the HLLB?
What is the tallest building in Utah?

context: <b5_0><b6_0>The main campus<b5_0/> in <a2_0>Provo, Utah<b6_0/><a2_0/>, United States sits on <a1_0>approximately 560<a1_0/> acres (2.3 km2) nestled at the base of the Wasatch Mountains and includes <a0_0>295<a0_0/> buildings. The buildings feature a wide variety of architectural styles, each building being built in the style of its time. The grass, trees, and flower beds on BYU's campus are impeccably maintained. Furthermore, views of the Wasatch Mountains, (including Mount Timpanogos) can be seen from the campus. BYU's <b7_0>Harold B. Lee Library<b7_0/> (also known as "HBLL"), which The Princeton Review ranked as the No. 1 "Great College Library" in 2004, has approximately 8½ million items in its collections, contains <a3_0>98<a3_0/> miles (158 km) of shelving, and can seat 4,600 people. The <a4_0><b8_0><b9_0>Spencer W. Kimball Tower<b9_0/><b8_0/><a4_0/>, shortened to SWKT and pronounced Swicket by many students, is home to several of the university's departments and programs and is the tallest building in Provo, Utah. Furthermore, BYU's Marriott Center, used as a basketball arena, can seat over 22,000 and is one of the largest on-campus arenas in the nation. Interestingly absent on the campus of this church owned university is a campus chapel. Notwithstanding, each Sunday LDS Church services for students are conducted on campus, but due to the large number of students attending these services, nearly all of the buildings and possible meeting spaces on campus are utilized (in addition, many students attend services off campus in LDS chapels in the surrounding communities).
